Dear 1st Grade Families,

In order to be ready for the first day of school on August 24, 2020, we will need to collect your iPad from last year so we can update them and install all the correct apps for 1st grade. The collection date will be Monday August 17th. You may drop them off at your respective elementary school anytime between 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM and by appt.

The iPads were scheduled to be replaced this year and we thought the new ones would have arrived by now and we could set them up and switch them out with you. Unfortunately, the delivery is delayed so we need to collect them, update them, and then get them back to you on Friday August 21, 2020. More details on the pick up times will follow shortly - which will also include other supplies for remote learning.

Thank you again for your patience and understanding.

We know that students and parents have many questions regarding end of the year activities, especially for graduating seniors. Dr. Theroux had already planned a meeting for this week to finalize the plans we have been working on, and we will make the necessary announcements regarding each activity no later than Monday April 27, 2020.

Thank you and stay well!

As we maneuver through this new way of life, we want to keep you as updated as possible with our attempts to keep our students healthy and nourished.

This week we are serving Smuckers Uncrustable PB&J’s. We are also adding a few heat and serve options, which include, a Pepperoni Calzone, Turkey, Ham and Cheese Stuffers and Grilled Cheese Sandwiches. Please heat the 3 hot choices to 165 degrees for 15 seconds. Along with these entrees, each lunch can contain, celery and carrots, broccoli cuts, carrots and/or cherry tomatoes. We also include a variety of fresh fruits, such as apples, oranges, kiwi and cuties. Applesauce is another favorite we like to include. Milk, Chocolate or white, are available as well. We are also offering a chip choice to keep it interesting!
We will continue to update our menu options, offer a variety of choices and keep you posted on the weekly items.

Thank you again to our volunteers and community partners that make our food assembly operation and distribution possible! We live in a generous community!

All 6th graders are invited to write an essay for a chance to win a full or partial scholarship. 8th grade NJHS members enjoy giving back to 6th graders and promoting outdoor educational opportunities at TMS.
